section.heading: 9-8-8 Suicide Prevention and Mental Health Crisis Lifeline Fund. Report

content.p: There is established an account to be known as the “9-8-8 Suicide Prevention and Mental Health Crisis Lifeline Fund” which shall be a separate, nonlapsing account within the General Fund. The account shall contain any moneys required to be deposited in, or transferred to, the account pursuant to subsection
of this section. Moneys in the account shall be expended by the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services solely for the following purposes:
Ensuring the efficient and effective routing of calls made to the 9-8-8 National Suicide Prevention Lifeline by persons in the state to an appropriate crisis center; and
personnel and the provision of acute mental health, crisis outreach and stabilization services by directly responding to the 9–8–8 National Suicide Prevention Lifeline.
The following moneys shall be deposited in, or transferred to, the 9-8-8 Suicide Prevention and Mental Health Crisis Lifeline Fund:
Any appropriation made by the General Assembly to the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services for deposit in the fund;
any grants or gifts intended for deposit in the fund; and
interest, premiums, gains or other earnings on the fund.
Moneys remaining in the 9-8-8 Suicide Prevention and Mental Health Crisis Lifeline Fund
shall not revert to the General Fund at the end of any fiscal year and remain available in subsequent fiscal years for the purposes described in subsection
shall not be subject to transfer to any other fund, or to transfer, assignment or reassignment for any purpose other than the purposes described in subsection

On or before January 1, 2024, and annually thereafter, the Commissioner of Mental Health and Addiction Services shall report, in accordance with the provisions of section11-4a, on the deposits and expenditures of the 9-8-8 Suicide Prevention and Mental Health Crisis Lifeline Fund to the joint standing committees of the General Assembly having cognizance of matters relating to appropriations and the budgets of state agencies, public health, human services and children.
